/wiki/Yakubu_Adesokan: Yakubu Adesokan ( born 16 July 1979 ) is a powerlifter from Nigeria . At the 2012 Summer Paralympics he won a gold medal in the men 's 48 kg powerlifting event , lifting 180 kg ( 397 lb ) .
/wiki/Powerlifting_at_the_2012_Summer_Pa: Powerlifting at the 2012 Summer Paralympics was held at ExCeL London from 30 August to 5 September , with a maximum of 200 athletes ( 120 men and 80 women ) , competing in 20 events . According to the classification rules of the International Federation for Powerlifting athletes which can not participate in weightlifting events because of a physical impairment affecting their legs or hips are deemed eligible to compete in powerlifting events at the Paralympics .
The men 's 48 kg powerlifting event at the 2012 Summer Paralympics was contested on 30 August at ExCeL London .
/wiki/Ivory_Nwokorie: Ivory Nwokorie MON is a Nigerian powerlifter who won the gold medal in the women 's 44 kg weight class at the 2012 Summer Paralympics in London , England . She was banned for two years in 2013 , after testing positive for Furosemide .
/wiki/Powerlifting_at_the_2012_Summer_Pa: The women 's 44 kg powerlifting event at the 2012 Summer Paralympics was contested on 31 August at ExCeL London .
/wiki/Esther_Oyema: Esther Oyema ( born 20 April 1982 ) is a Nigerian powerlifter . She competed in the women 's 61 kg event at the 2014 Commonwealth Games where she won a gold medal and set a new world record by lifting 122.4 kg in the heavyweight category . In 2015 she won a gold medal at the All-Africa Games by lifting 133 kg and beating her previous record 126 kg . In the same year she traveled all the way to Almaty , Kazakhstan where she won another gold medal at the IPC Powerlifting Asian Open Championships by lifting 79 kg . During the 2016 Summer Paralympics she won a silver medal by beating her Mexican counterpart Amalia Perez in the women 's 55 kg lifting .
/wiki/Powerlifting_at_the_2012_Summer_Pa: The women 's 48 kg powerlifting event at the 2012 Summer Paralympics was contested on 1 September at ExCeL London .
/wiki/Joy_Onaolapo: Joy Onaolapo ( 24 December 1982 in Sapele , Nigeria - July 2013 ) was a Nigerian champion Paralympic weightlifter ( 2012 ) . She won the gold medal in the 52 kg powerlifting category at the 2012 London games . Onaolapo was confirmed dead in July 2013 at the age of 30 . Nigerian former President Goodluck Ebele Jonathan described the death of the Nigerian Paralympian gold medallist , Mrs. Joy Onaolapo as a big loss to the nation . Coach Ijeoma Iheriobim , has described late Onaolapo as a committed and diligent athlete .
/wiki/Powerlifting_at_the_2012_Summer_Pa: The women 's 52 kg powerlifting event at the 2012 Summer Paralympics was contested on 1 September at ExCeL London .
/wiki/Loveline_Obiji: Loveline Obiji ( born 11 September 1990 ) is a Nigerian powerlifter . She competed in the women 's +61 kg event at the 2014 Commonwealth Games where she won a gold medal . At the 2016 Summer Paralympics she was the 86kg category gold medal briefly as Randa Mahmoud 's r world record setting last lift was not allowed . However Mahmoud appealed and her lift was allowed giving her the gold medal and the world record . Obiji took the silver .
/wiki/Powerlifting_at_the_2012_Summer_Pa: The women 's 82.5 kg powerlifting event at the 2012 Summer Paralympics was contested on 4 September at ExCeL London .
/wiki/Grace_Anozie: Grace Ebere Anozie ( born 1977 ) is a Nigerian Paralympian in powerlifting . Anonzie first Paralympic medal was a bronze at the 2004 Summer Paralympics in the 82.5 kg event . At subsequent Paralympics , Anozie won a silver medal in 2008 and gold in 2012 . During her career , Anonzie set multiple powerlifting records including a Paralympic record at the 2008 Summer Paralympics in the over 86kg event .
/wiki/Powerlifting_at_the_2012_Summer_Pa: The women 's +82.5 kg powerlifting event at the 2012 Summer Paralympics was contested on 5 September at ExCeL London .
/wiki/Ikechukwu_Obichukwu: Ikechukwu Obichukwu is a Nigerian Paralympic powerlifter . He represented Nigeria at the 2012 Summer Paralympics and he won the silver medal in the men 's 52 kg event . He also represented Nigeria at the 2010 Commonwealth Games where he won the bronze medal in the men 's Open bench press event .
/wiki/Powerlifting_at_the_2012_Summer_Pa: The men 's 52 kg powerlifting event at the 2012 Summer Paralympics was contested on 31 August at ExCeL London .
/wiki/Anthony_Ulonnam: Anthony Ulonnam is a Nigerian Paralympic powerlifter . He represented Nigeria at the 2012 Summer Paralympics and he won the silver medal in the men 's 56 kg event . He represented Nigeria at the 2010 Commonwealth Games and he won the silver medal in the men 's Open bench press event . At the 2014 World Championships he won the bronze medal in the men 's 59 kg event . At the 2015 African Games he won the silver medal in the men 's 59 kg event .
/wiki/Powerlifting_at_the_2012_Summer_Pa: The men 's 56 kg powerlifting event at the 2012 Summer Paralympics was contested on 31 August at ExCeL London .
/wiki/Ifeanyi_Nnajiofor: Ifeanyi Nnajiofor is a Nigerian Paralympic powerlifter . He represented Nigeria at the 2012 Summer Paralympics and he won the silver medal in the men 's 60 kg event .
/wiki/Powerlifting_at_the_2012_Summer_Pa: The men 's 60 kg powerlifting event at the 2012 Summer Paralympics was contested on 1 September at ExCeL London .
/wiki/Lucy_Ogechukwu_Ejike: Lucy Ogechukwu Ejike ( born 16 October 1977 ) is a Nigerian Paralympic powerlifter . She has represented her country at five consecutive Paralympic Games from 2000 in Sydney through to 2016 in Rio de Janeiro . She has won medals at each , three gold and two silver .
/wiki/Powerlifting_at_the_2012_Summer_Pa: The women 's 56 kg powerlifting event at the 2012 Summer Paralympics was contested on 2 September at ExCeL London .
/wiki/Folashade_Oluwafemiayo: Folashade Alice Oluwafemiayo ( born 1985 ) is a Nigerian Paralympian athlete .
/wiki/Powerlifting_at_the_2012_Summer_Pa: The women 's 75 kg powerlifting event at the 2012 Summer Paralympics was contested on 3 September at ExCeL London .
/wiki/Eucharia_Iyiazi: Eucharia Njideka Iyiazi ( born 19 November 1973 ) is a Paralympian athlete from Nigeria competing mainly in category F57/58 shot put and discus throw events . She has competed at four paralympics taking two gold , a silver and two bronze medals . Iyiazi competed in the 2008 Summer Paralympics in Beijing , China . There , she won a gold medal in both the women 's shot putt F57/F58 event and the womens discus throw F57/F58 event . At the Beijing Paralympics , Iyiazzi set the world and Paralympic record for the F58 class in shot put and discus . Iyiazi took a bronze medal in the 2012 Summer Paralympics in London and then threw 27.54m to again take the discus bronze at the 2016 Summer Paralympics .
/wiki/Athletics_at_the_2012_Summer_Paral: Athletics events at the 2012 Summer Paralympics were held in the Olympic Stadium and in The Mall in London , United Kingdom , from 31 August to 9 September 2012 .

The Women 's Shot Put athletics events for the 2012 Summer Paralympics took place at the London Olympic Stadium from September 1 to September 8 , 2012 . A total of 9 events were contested incorporating 16 different classifications .
/wiki/Victoria_Nneji: Victoria Nneji ( born 1972 ) was a Nigerian Paralympian athlete . At the 2012 Women 's Powerlifting 67.5kg event , she won bronze medal . After the event , she announced her retired from competitive sports citing recurrent injuries and her age as reasons .
/wiki/Powerlifting_at_the_2012_Summer_Pa: The women 's 67.5 kg powerlifting event at the 2012 Summer Paralympics was contested on 3 September at ExCeL London .
